intro: Chaetogastra longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepal chaetogastra, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its striking, elongated sepals that are often brightly colored, which play a role in attracting pollinators. Its flowers typically bloom in clusters and are noted for their intricate structure and ornamental value. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
